issue.title: XYChart x axis is not sequential / breaking for sparse data sets
issue.body:
I have sparse data sets that don't always share the same x coordinate and it seems to be breaking the XYChart. Here is a screenshot of what I'm seeing even though the data sets overlap on dates and should all be stacked on top of each other. They don't all contain the same x axis dates because they track events, and one line may have an event occur on a day where other lines do not have an event occur.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702655-a6ea0fac-2bd3-4863-ac50-70b7da381b50.png)

For code to reproduce what I believe is the issue I made some small changes to the XYChart code from the docs by updating data1 and data2 to not share all of their x coordinates, causing the x axis to display 0 1 3 2 4 (and no 15 even though it's in data2). The code is below.

[codesandbox link](https://codesandbox.io/s/jovial-glade-ez26u2?file=/src/App.js)

Am I missing something, or is this not supposed to be happening?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702128-5c2f0e21-0a2c-408b-a649-c7633d7a847f.png)

issue.title: XYChart x axis is not sequential / breaking for sparse data sets
issue.body:
I have sparse data sets that don't always share the same x coordinate and it seems to be breaking the XYChart. Here is a screenshot of what I'm seeing even though the data sets overlap on dates and should all be stacked on top of each other. They don't all contain the same x axis dates because they track events, and one line may have an event occur on a day where other lines do not have an event occur.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702655-a6ea0fac-2bd3-4863-ac50-70b7da381b50.png)

For code to reproduce what I believe is the issue I made some small changes to the XYChart code from the docs by updating data1 and data2 to not share all of their x coordinates, causing the x axis to display 0 1 3 2 4 (and no 15 even though it's in data2). The code is below.

[codesandbox link](https://codesandbox.io/s/jovial-glade-ez26u2?file=/src/App.js)

Am I missing something, or is this not supposed to be happening?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702128-5c2f0e21-0a2c-408b-a649-c7633d7a847f.png)

comment.body: Hi @MiguelTolosa this is because you've specified a `type: 'band'` scale, which is treated as an `ordinal` (aka categorical) value type as you can read in the [`d3-scale` docs](https://github.com/d3/d3-scale#band-scales). that means that every x-value, if different, will be added to the scale in the order it's encountered. If you update this to `time` for your complex example or `linear` in your linked sandbox it will be fixed.

issue.title: Airbnb has a major design flaw
issue.body:
Sorry for posting this here. I use visx professionally and Airbnb hurt me today with a design flaw which needs to be addressed -- it breaks my heart. Please fix this so other people don't get hurt. You are supposed to use technology to improve people's lives.

Steps to recreate bug.

1. Send message to airbnb first host asking if they have decent wifi because I'm a software engineer who works remote
2. Do crime research for that neighborhood and instead look for a host a few miles away
3. Find a different, second, host. Choose dates to stay. Write a message to the second host about myself and why I'm staying.
4. Press the request button

I wake up in the morning to these messages. This is design output. This is the responsibility of the design team at Airbnb to make sure that the end user, me, clearly understands the intent of the messages.

![IMG_5887](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/232388/198124245-ba394849-4a80-49ac-afca-0c803036a9fd.PNG)

5. Interpret the message: a. My request to stay at second host's property has been accepted. b. Follow the link to pay for the second host's property. When looking at the button to complete the transaction there isn't visible the property information I'm paying for. I assume that I'm paying the for second host's property in Gulfport.
6. Realize that I paid for the first host property which I didn't want
7. Request a cancellation and refund.
8. When denied for a refund, offer $200 immediate loss for a cancellation and refund the difference which is refused.

I'm on the hook for a $2,300 loss having booked two airbnb stays on the same dates. This isn't my fault. The text messages Airbnb sent me are very misleading.

I don't care about the outcome. I'm sure based on the customer support from airbnb your legal team will be very upset if you respond to this. Please forward this to your design team so that other people don't get hurt and needlessly lose $2,300 because of your design flaw. I successfully use visx professionally. If I can't understand a user interface, it means that it has a very serous flaw. Please have empathy for your users.

issue.title: Visx/zoom react 18 typescript error
issue.body:
Hi everyone!

I tried to upgrade a project to React 18 with Typescript, when using the `<Zoom></Zoom>` component I get this TS error:
```
'Zoom' cannot be used as a JSX component.
  Its instance type 'Zoom' is not a valid JSX element.
    The types returned by 'render()' are incompatible between these types.
      Type '{} | null | undefined' is not assignable to type 'ReactNode'.
        Type '{}' is not assignable to type 'ReactNode'.
          Type '{}' is missing the following properties from type 'ReactPortal': key, children, type, props
```

I created a simple [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/s/bold-monad-nq73of?file=/src/App.tsx) to reproduce the error. The dependencies are the latest ones, both for React and Visx.

Do you have any idea how to solve it?

Thank you!

comment.body: Hi @GabriFila your sandbox references `@vx/zoom` which is now deprecated in favor of `@visx/zoom`. here's an [updated sandbox](https://codesandbox.io/s/elastic-pond-zmtw5b?file=/src/App.tsx).

issue.title: SplitLinePath takes a long time to render with certain curves
issue.body:
For some reason, `<SplitLinePath>` is taking a long time to render when paired with certain curves.

**Reproduction:** 

https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-ts-mgzfrj?file=App.tsx 

Open the above link in a new tab and react profiling tools and you will see that the render is taking a long time (>100ms on a new M1 Mac)

![Screen Shot 2022-10-25 at 12 22 19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1286001/197863380-a6686fcc-e8bf-4422-9597-8c54fdedbac2.png)

This only seems to occur for smooth curves like `curveMonotoneX`, `curveNatural` and `curveCardinal`.

This only seems to affect `<SplitLinePath>` while rendering the same data with the same curves as two separate line paths only takes a couple of milliseconds.

comment.body: Hey @valtism thanks for reporting this 🙏 my guess would be the algorithm it's using to sample points for some curves might not be performant. @kristw any thoughts?

pull_request.title: internal(github-actions): add github release script
pull_request.body:
#### :house: Internal

Currently we don't create a formal [Github release](https://github.com/airbnb/visx/releases) when we release new package versions, but ideally they are up-to-date with the changelog.

This adds a script to create a release anytime we update the changelog. Logic is based on the [Github release API docs](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/releases/releases#create-a-release). These are hard to test, so the next PR can be a test-case :)

@hshoff @kristw

issue.title: Any plans to add Bubble chart?
issue.body:
Hi Team,
Is there Bubble chart available with visx library? I want to draw a bubble chart like below,
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/109575982/196887448-d1aeb6de-4745-4954-9af4-ed447a142fe0.png)

It should be greyed out when no data.

comment.body:
Hi @sanjoydey22 👋  thanks for checking out visx. I'm converting this to a discussion as it's already supported. 

visx is a **low-level** component library, which means it's more like `d3` than `highcharts`. To create a bubble chart you could use
- `@visx/scale` – position, scale, and/or color circles based on data attributes, you can render these with native `<svg />` and `circle />` elements and control aesthetics as you like
  - `@visx/responsive` could help you make this responsive to screen size
- `@visx/xychart` – this is the only "high-level" chart library in `visx`, it has a `GlpyhSeries` which allows you to render whatever shape (e.g., a circle) you want.

Warning: findDOMNode is deprecated in StrictMode. findDOMNode was passed an instance of withBoundingRects() which is inside StrictMode. Instead, add a ref directly to the element you want to reference. Learn more about using refs safely here: https://fb.me/react-strict-mode-find-node

comment.body: I think there's something about explicitly exporting type names. while we export types elsewhere ([example](https://github.com/airbnb/visx/blob/master/packages/visx-scale/src/index.ts#L26)) it’s not a mix of component + types. my only thought at this point is that we generate both `esm` and `cjs` builds I think types (`.d.ts` files) are only exported for the `cjs` build, so if you export anything by name / that’s not `*` you might get a not defined error.

pull_request.title: fix(tooltip, bounds): replace findDOMNode with refs for TooltipWithBounds
pull_request.body:
#### :bug: Bug Fix
This pull request extends the withBoundingRects to use optional refs instead of findDomNode. This should solve the deprecation warning in R18 with strictMode as discussed [here](https://github.com/airbnb/visx/issues/737)
To check the fix please enable `reactStrictMode: true` in `next.config.js` in the demo package. 

This _should_ not introduce any breaking changes. If the res is not passed, withBoundingRects falls back to findDOMNode. I would appreaciate pointers on how to correctly type the `nodeRef` in `TooltipWithBounds.tsx`

pull_request.title: feat(tooltip): Enable custom portal container for tooltip
pull_request.body:
#### :rocket: Enhancements

- Enables setting a custom container for the tooltip portal when using `useTooltipInPortal`, via the `portalContainer` property.

Currently, when using `useTooltipInPortal`, the tooltip renders at the root of the document. My team is running into an issue where we are sometimes rendering a dropdown in a static tooltip, but the dropdown menu appears behind the tooltip. Setting hacky z indexes would not robustly fix the issue if there is another overlay layer that is supposed to be under the tooltip, and we figured that if we could tell the tooltip portal where to render, we could fix the bug in a clean way.

I've updated the tooltip example to show that use case:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206148-c73b224d-9937-4c33-af4d-9779ca4a8fa3.mov

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206164-970cc2c9-01dd-4d72-984a-1b34b3b6cddc.mov

comment.body:
hmm, I don't think this will necessarily update the way we want, it's just computed once and if the container changes sizes or moves this will be stale/wrong.

this is the advantage of `useMeasure`, I'm a bit apprehensive of adding this if it's potentially going to result in issues of it being stale / incorrectly positioned.

pull_request.title: feat(axis): add an ability to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis
pull_request.body:
Hi, everyone! First of all, I want to say, that I'm impressed by the `visx` project, and I'm happy that I discovered it for myself! 

Currently, we are migrating our system from `recharts` to `visx` and found out that there is no way to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis. Such ability is present in `recharts` (https://recharts.org/en-US/api/XAxis#padding, https://recharts.org/en-US/api/YAxis#padding), and now we need to work around it using `hideAxisLine` option and our custom line. So it will be nice to have it also in `visx`.  

#### :rocket: Enhancements

- add an ability to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis

review.body:
Hi @andreykrupskii 👋  thanks for the contribution and apologies for the delayed review – have been super busy recently so I appreciate the reminder ping 🙏 

This looks great to me! I just poked CI to run and can land it after that passes. Thanks for adding tests as well! 🔥

issue.title: security(visx/scale): Update for d3-color dependencies?
issue.body: Given this vulnerability https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-36jr-mh4h-2g58, it would be great to get an update of all visx packages that directly and indirectly use `d3-color`.

comment.body:
thanks for opening this. we don't have any direct dependencies on `d3-color`, but `yarn why d3-color` gives

```
=> Found "@visx/scale#d3-color@2.0.0"
info Reasons this module exists
   - "_project_#@visx#scale#d3-scale#d3-interpolate" depends on it
```

This affects `d3-color` versions `<3.1.0`. The `yarn.lock` file in our repo shouldn't affect consumers necessarily, they should be able to force resolve that to whatever they want. Seems like the best we could do is bump `d3-scale` in `@visx/scale`. But `d3-scale` still specifies [`"d3-interpolate": "1.2.0 - 3"`](https://github.com/d3/d3-scale/blob/83555bd759c7314420bd4240642beda5e258db9e/package.json) and `d3-interpolate` still specifies [`"d3-color": "1 - 3"`](https://github.com/d3/d3-interpolate/blob/6562b85040f7a9b96efe49b54a77eb6fceafa1c1/package.json) so even that wouldn't guarantee a fix until those packages are updated.

issue.title: feat(tooltip): Enable custom portal container for tooltip
issue.body:
#### :rocket: Enhancements

- Enables setting a custom container for the tooltip portal when using `useTooltipInPortal`, via the `portalContainer` property.

Currently, when using `useTooltipInPortal`, the tooltip renders at the root of the document. My team is running into an issue where we are sometimes rendering a dropdown in a static tooltip, but the dropdown menu appears behind the tooltip. Setting hacky z indexes would not robustly fix the issue if there is another overlay layer that is supposed to be under the tooltip, and we figured that if we could tell the tooltip portal where to render, we could fix the bug in a clean way.

I've updated the tooltip example to show that use case:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206148-c73b224d-9937-4c33-af4d-9779ca4a8fa3.mov

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206164-970cc2c9-01dd-4d72-984a-1b34b3b6cddc.mov

this can be quite expensive to call each render which is why we opted to use `useMeasure` for the `container`. 

Is it necessary to support the `portalContainerProp` override or can it be passed in as an option? if this simplifies things we could leave it for now.

issue.title: Visx leaves unwanted padding on svg element
issue.body: Hi there, I know this isn't a bug but looking for a way to left align or make 100% width this chart and couldn't find anything on the docs. Are there any options available to do this? Right now there is about 50px of padding in the .

comment.body:
Hi @ryanbrwr 👋  thanks for checking out `visx`. This isn't an issue it's a usage question so I'm converting it to a discussion.

I assume you are using the `@visx/xychart` package, which sets a default [`margin: { top: number; right: number; bottom: number; left: number; }`](https://airbnb.io/visx/docs/xychart#XYChart_margin) on the chart. You can update that to include a `margin.left=0` if you want. it's the default to accommodate `top/right/bottom/left` axes.

Hello!

What would be the best way to smoothly animate translation?

Say, that by double clicking a geo feature, I set a new transformMatrix with a new translation position, and it smoothly interpolates to said position.

Is this possible with visx/react-spring? Time is not on my side and I was hoping some guidance would help me bury my head in the right place haha.

Also, I was hoping to achieve a similar goal with scale, say, setting a new scale and it smoothly interpolates into the new scale setting.

comment.body:
hey @coding-tomato 👋  thanks for checking out visx, since this is a usage question I'm going to move this to a discussion.

I don't have a ton of time to dig in currently (maybe someone else can!), my thinking is that `react-spring` itself might be a good avenue for animating this. in can interpolate some data structures, but not all.

issue.title: fix(grid): refactor imports to not cause de-optimization for esm bundlers
issue.body:
#### :rocket: Enhancements

When importing from `@visx/grid/lib/shapes/Line` it forces bundlers to use the CommonJS version instead of the ECMAScript Module version which leads to larger bundle sizes due to lacking tree-shaking capabilities (CommonJS uses `require` statements).

If the types are not exposed from the root barrel file they should reside in their own import as type imports will be omitted.

comment.body: hi @lukasholzer @ximenean happy to attempt a merge, CI is still failing so it needs to be rebased as a start

issue.title: @visx/area graph has stroke on the borders of the graph

comment.body:
Hi @chanzer0 👋  thanks for checking out `visx`. this is a usage question so moving it to discussion not an issue. 

this outline is a consequence of how `path` borders work. you can remove it entirely by setting `strokeWidth={0}/stroke="transparent"`. alternatively if you only want to render a border on one side of the area, you need to also render a `LinePath` from `@visx/shape` – see this for an example https://airbnb.io/visx/glyphs

issue.title: XYChart x axis is not sequential / breaking for sparse data sets
issue.body:
I have sparse data sets that don't always share the same x coordinate and it seems to be breaking the XYChart. Here is a screenshot of what I'm seeing even though the data sets overlap on dates and should all be stacked on top of each other. They don't all contain the same x axis dates because they track events, and one line may have an event occur on a day where other lines do not have an event occur.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702655-a6ea0fac-2bd3-4863-ac50-70b7da381b50.png)

For code to reproduce what I believe is the issue I made some small changes to the XYChart code from the docs by updating data1 and data2 to not share all of their x coordinates, causing the x axis to display 0 1 3 2 4 (and no 15 even though it's in data2). The code is below.

[codesandbox link](https://codesandbox.io/s/jovial-glade-ez26u2?file=/src/App.js)

Am I missing something, or is this not supposed to be happening?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702128-5c2f0e21-0a2c-408b-a649-c7633d7a847f.png)

issue.title: XYChart x axis is not sequential / breaking for sparse data sets
issue.body:
I have sparse data sets that don't always share the same x coordinate and it seems to be breaking the XYChart. Here is a screenshot of what I'm seeing even though the data sets overlap on dates and should all be stacked on top of each other. They don't all contain the same x axis dates because they track events, and one line may have an event occur on a day where other lines do not have an event occur.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702655-a6ea0fac-2bd3-4863-ac50-70b7da381b50.png)

For code to reproduce what I believe is the issue I made some small changes to the XYChart code from the docs by updating data1 and data2 to not share all of their x coordinates, causing the x axis to display 0 1 3 2 4 (and no 15 even though it's in data2). The code is below.

[codesandbox link](https://codesandbox.io/s/jovial-glade-ez26u2?file=/src/App.js)

Am I missing something, or is this not supposed to be happening?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702128-5c2f0e21-0a2c-408b-a649-c7633d7a847f.png)

comment.body: Hi @MiguelTolosa this is because you've specified a `type: 'band'` scale, which is treated as an `ordinal` (aka categorical) value type as you can read in the [`d3-scale` docs](https://github.com/d3/d3-scale#band-scales). that means that every x-value, if different, will be added to the scale in the order it's encountered. If you update this to `time` for your complex example or `linear` in your linked sandbox it will be fixed.

issue.title: Airbnb has a major design flaw
issue.body:
Sorry for posting this here. I use visx professionally and Airbnb hurt me today with a design flaw which needs to be addressed -- it breaks my heart. Please fix this so other people don't get hurt. You are supposed to use technology to improve people's lives.

Steps to recreate bug.

1. Send message to airbnb first host asking if they have decent wifi because I'm a software engineer who works remote
2. Do crime research for that neighborhood and instead look for a host a few miles away
3. Find a different, second, host. Choose dates to stay. Write a message to the second host about myself and why I'm staying.
4. Press the request button

I wake up in the morning to these messages. This is design output. This is the responsibility of the design team at Airbnb to make sure that the end user, me, clearly understands the intent of the messages.

![IMG_5887](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/232388/198124245-ba394849-4a80-49ac-afca-0c803036a9fd.PNG)

5. Interpret the message: a. My request to stay at second host's property has been accepted. b. Follow the link to pay for the second host's property. When looking at the button to complete the transaction there isn't visible the property information I'm paying for. I assume that I'm paying the for second host's property in Gulfport.
6. Realize that I paid for the first host property which I didn't want
7. Request a cancellation and refund.
8. When denied for a refund, offer $200 immediate loss for a cancellation and refund the difference which is refused.

I'm on the hook for a $2,300 loss having booked two airbnb stays on the same dates. This isn't my fault. The text messages Airbnb sent me are very misleading.

I don't care about the outcome. I'm sure based on the customer support from airbnb your legal team will be very upset if you respond to this. Please forward this to your design team so that other people don't get hurt and needlessly lose $2,300 because of your design flaw. I successfully use visx professionally. If I can't understand a user interface, it means that it has a very serous flaw. Please have empathy for your users.

issue.title: Visx/zoom react 18 typescript error
issue.body:
Hi everyone!

I tried to upgrade a project to React 18 with Typescript, when using the `<Zoom></Zoom>` component I get this TS error:
```
'Zoom' cannot be used as a JSX component.
  Its instance type 'Zoom' is not a valid JSX element.
    The types returned by 'render()' are incompatible between these types.
      Type '{} | null | undefined' is not assignable to type 'ReactNode'.
        Type '{}' is not assignable to type 'ReactNode'.
          Type '{}' is missing the following properties from type 'ReactPortal': key, children, type, props
```

I created a simple [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/s/bold-monad-nq73of?file=/src/App.tsx) to reproduce the error. The dependencies are the latest ones, both for React and Visx.

Do you have any idea how to solve it?

Thank you!

issue.title: SplitLinePath takes a long time to render with certain curves
issue.body:
For some reason, `<SplitLinePath>` is taking a long time to render when paired with certain curves.

**Reproduction:** 

https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-ts-mgzfrj?file=App.tsx 

Open the above link in a new tab and react profiling tools and you will see that the render is taking a long time (>100ms on a new M1 Mac)

![Screen Shot 2022-10-25 at 12 22 19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1286001/197863380-a6686fcc-e8bf-4422-9597-8c54fdedbac2.png)

This only seems to occur for smooth curves like `curveMonotoneX`, `curveNatural` and `curveCardinal`.

This only seems to affect `<SplitLinePath>` while rendering the same data with the same curves as two separate line paths only takes a couple of milliseconds.

issue.title: Any plans to add Bubble chart?
issue.body:
Hi Team,
Is there Bubble chart available with visx library? I want to draw a bubble chart like below,
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/109575982/196887448-d1aeb6de-4745-4954-9af4-ed447a142fe0.png)

It should be greyed out when no data.

comment.body:
Hi @sanjoydey22 👋  thanks for checking out visx. I'm converting this to a discussion as it's already supported. 

visx is a **low-level** component library, which means it's more like `d3` than `highcharts`. To create a bubble chart you could use
- `@visx/scale` – position, scale, and/or color circles based on data attributes, you can render these with native `<svg />` and `circle />` elements and control aesthetics as you like
  - `@visx/responsive` could help you make this responsive to screen size
- `@visx/xychart` – this is the only "high-level" chart library in `visx`, it has a `GlpyhSeries` which allows you to render whatever shape (e.g., a circle) you want.

pull_request.title: fix(tooltip, bounds): replace findDOMNode with refs for TooltipWithBounds
pull_request.body:
#### :bug: Bug Fix
This pull request extends the withBoundingRects to use optional refs instead of findDomNode. This should solve the deprecation warning in R18 with strictMode as discussed [here](https://github.com/airbnb/visx/issues/737)
To check the fix please enable `reactStrictMode: true` in `next.config.js` in the demo package. 

This _should_ not introduce any breaking changes. If the res is not passed, withBoundingRects falls back to findDOMNode. I would appreaciate pointers on how to correctly type the `nodeRef` in `TooltipWithBounds.tsx`

pull_request.title: feat(tooltip): Enable custom portal container for tooltip
pull_request.body:
#### :rocket: Enhancements

- Enables setting a custom container for the tooltip portal when using `useTooltipInPortal`, via the `portalContainer` property.

Currently, when using `useTooltipInPortal`, the tooltip renders at the root of the document. My team is running into an issue where we are sometimes rendering a dropdown in a static tooltip, but the dropdown menu appears behind the tooltip. Setting hacky z indexes would not robustly fix the issue if there is another overlay layer that is supposed to be under the tooltip, and we figured that if we could tell the tooltip portal where to render, we could fix the bug in a clean way.

I've updated the tooltip example to show that use case:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206148-c73b224d-9937-4c33-af4d-9779ca4a8fa3.mov

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206164-970cc2c9-01dd-4d72-984a-1b34b3b6cddc.mov

comment.body:
hmm, I don't think this will necessarily update the way we want, it's just computed once and if the container changes sizes or moves this will be stale/wrong.

this is the advantage of `useMeasure`, I'm a bit apprehensive of adding this if it's potentially going to result in issues of it being stale / incorrectly positioned.

commits.message: feat(axis): add an ability to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis (#1574)

pull_request.title: feat(axis): add an ability to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis
pull_request.body:
Hi, everyone! First of all, I want to say, that I'm impressed by the `visx` project, and I'm happy that I discovered it for myself! 

Currently, we are migrating our system from `recharts` to `visx` and found out that there is no way to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis. Such ability is present in `recharts` (https://recharts.org/en-US/api/XAxis#padding, https://recharts.org/en-US/api/YAxis#padding), and now we need to work around it using `hideAxisLine` option and our custom line. So it will be nice to have it also in `visx`.  

#### :rocket: Enhancements

- add an ability to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis

review.body:
Hi @andreykrupskii 👋  thanks for the contribution and apologies for the delayed review – have been super busy recently so I appreciate the reminder ping 🙏 

This looks great to me! I just poked CI to run and can land it after that passes. Thanks for adding tests as well! 🔥

issue.title: security(visx/scale): Update for d3-color dependencies?
issue.body: Given this vulnerability https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-36jr-mh4h-2g58, it would be great to get an update of all visx packages that directly and indirectly use `d3-color`.

comment.body:
thanks for opening this. we don't have any direct dependencies on `d3-color`, but `yarn why d3-color` gives

```
=> Found "@visx/scale#d3-color@2.0.0"
info Reasons this module exists
   - "_project_#@visx#scale#d3-scale#d3-interpolate" depends on it
```

This affects `d3-color` versions `<3.1.0`. The `yarn.lock` file in our repo shouldn't affect consumers necessarily, they should be able to force resolve that to whatever they want. Seems like the best we could do is bump `d3-scale` in `@visx/scale`. But `d3-scale` still specifies [`"d3-interpolate": "1.2.0 - 3"`](https://github.com/d3/d3-scale/blob/83555bd759c7314420bd4240642beda5e258db9e/package.json) and `d3-interpolate` still specifies [`"d3-color": "1 - 3"`](https://github.com/d3/d3-interpolate/blob/6562b85040f7a9b96efe49b54a77eb6fceafa1c1/package.json) so even that wouldn't guarantee a fix until those packages are updated.

this can be quite expensive to call each render which is why we opted to use `useMeasure` for the `container`. 

Is it necessary to support the `portalContainerProp` override or can it be passed in as an option? If the latter is fine we could use `useMeasure` for the `portalContainer` as well. that's tricky though because it may not always update when an element resize happens etc. (which is what `forceRefreshBounds` is for)

comment.body:
Hi @ryanbrwr 👋  thanks for checking out `visx`. This isn't an issue it's a usage question so I'm converting it to a discussion.

I assume you are using the `@visx/xychart` package, which sets a default [`margin: { top: number; right: number; bottom: number; left: number; }`](https://airbnb.io/visx/docs/xychart#XYChart_margin) on the chart. You can update that to include a `margin.left=0` if you want. it's the default to accommodate `top/right/bottom/left` axes.

issue.title: fix(grid): refactor imports to not cause de-optimization for esm bundlers
issue.body:
#### :rocket: Enhancements

When importing from `@visx/grid/lib/shapes/Line` it forces bundlers to use the CommonJS version instead of the ECMAScript Module version which leads to larger bundle sizes due to lacking tree-shaking capabilities (CommonJS uses `require` statements).

If the types are not exposed from the root barrel file they should reside in their own import as type imports will be omitted.

comment.body: hi @lukasholzer @ximenean happy to attempt a merge, CI is still failing so it needs to be rebased as a start

issue.title: @visx/area graph has stroke on the borders of the graph

comment.body:
Hi @chanzer0 👋  thanks for checking out `visx`. this is a usage question so moving it to discussion not an issue. 

this outline is a consequence of how `path` borders work. you can remove it entirely by setting `strokeWidth={0}/stroke="transparent"`. alternatively if you only want to render a border on one side of the area, you need to also render a `LinePath` from `@visx/shape` – see this for an example https://airbnb.io/visx/glyphs

issue.title: XYChart x axis is not sequential / breaking for sparse data sets
issue.body:
I have sparse data sets that don't always share the same x coordinate and it seems to be breaking the XYChart. Here is a screenshot of what I'm seeing even though the data sets overlap on dates and should all be stacked on top of each other. They don't all contain the same x axis dates because they track events, and one line may have an event occur on a day where other lines do not have an event occur.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702655-a6ea0fac-2bd3-4863-ac50-70b7da381b50.png)

For code to reproduce what I believe is the issue I made some small changes to the XYChart code from the docs by updating data1 and data2 to not share all of their x coordinates, causing the x axis to display 0 1 3 2 4 (and no 15 even though it's in data2). The code is below.

[codesandbox link](https://codesandbox.io/s/jovial-glade-ez26u2?file=/src/App.js)

Am I missing something, or is this not supposed to be happening?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702128-5c2f0e21-0a2c-408b-a649-c7633d7a847f.png)

issue.title: XYChart x axis is not sequential / breaking for sparse data sets
issue.body:
I have sparse data sets that don't always share the same x coordinate and it seems to be breaking the XYChart. Here is a screenshot of what I'm seeing even though the data sets overlap on dates and should all be stacked on top of each other. They don't all contain the same x axis dates because they track events, and one line may have an event occur on a day where other lines do not have an event occur.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702655-a6ea0fac-2bd3-4863-ac50-70b7da381b50.png)

For code to reproduce what I believe is the issue I made some small changes to the XYChart code from the docs by updating data1 and data2 to not share all of their x coordinates, causing the x axis to display 0 1 3 2 4 (and no 15 even though it's in data2). The code is below.

[codesandbox link](https://codesandbox.io/s/jovial-glade-ez26u2?file=/src/App.js)

Am I missing something, or is this not supposed to be happening?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10201870/204702128-5c2f0e21-0a2c-408b-a649-c7633d7a847f.png)

comment.body: Hi @MiguelTolosa this is because you've specified a `type: 'band'` scale, which is treated as an `ordinal` (aka categorical) value type as you can read in the [`d3-scale` docs](https://github.com/d3/d3-scale#band-scales). that means that every x-value, if different, will be added to the scale in the order it's encountered. If you update this to `time` for your complex example or `linear` in your linked sandbox it will be fixed.

issue.title: Airbnb has a major design flaw
issue.body:
Sorry for posting this here. I use visx professionally and Airbnb hurt me today with a design flaw which needs to be addressed -- it breaks my heart. Please fix this so other people don't get hurt. You are supposed to use technology to improve people's lives.

Steps to recreate bug.

1. Send message to airbnb first host asking if they have decent wifi because I'm a software engineer who works remote
2. Do crime research for that neighborhood and instead look for a host a few miles away
3. Find a different, second, host. Choose dates to stay. Write a message to the second host about myself and why I'm staying.
4. Press the request button

I wake up in the morning to these messages. This is design output. This is the responsibility of the design team at Airbnb to make sure that the end user, me, clearly understands the intent of the messages.

![IMG_5887](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/232388/198124245-ba394849-4a80-49ac-afca-0c803036a9fd.PNG)

5. Interpret the message: a. My request to stay at second host's property has been accepted. b. Follow the link to pay for the second host's property. When looking at the button to complete the transaction there isn't visible the property information I'm paying for. I assume that I'm paying the for second host's property in Gulfport.
6. Realize that I paid for the first host property which I didn't want
7. Request a cancellation and refund.
8. When denied for a refund, offer $200 immediate loss for a cancellation and refund the difference which is refused.

I'm on the hook for a $2,300 loss having booked two airbnb stays on the same dates. This isn't my fault. The text messages Airbnb sent me are very misleading.

I don't care about the outcome. I'm sure based on the customer support from airbnb your legal team will be very upset if you respond to this. Please forward this to your design team so that other people don't get hurt and needlessly lose $2,300 because of your design flaw. I successfully use visx professionally. If I can't understand a user interface, it means that it has a very serous flaw. Please have empathy for your users.

issue.title: Any plans to add Bubble chart?
issue.body:
Hi Team,
Is there Bubble chart available with visx library? I want to draw a bubble chart like below,
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/109575982/196887448-d1aeb6de-4745-4954-9af4-ed447a142fe0.png)

It should be greyed out when no data.

comment.body:
Hi @sanjoydey22 👋  thanks for checking out visx. I'm converting this to a discussion as it's already supported. 

visx is a **low-level** component library, which means it's more like `d3` than `highcharts`. To create a bubble chart you could use
- `@visx/scale` – position, scale, and/or color circles based on data attributes, you can render these with native `<svg />` and `circle />` elements and control aesthetics as you like
  - `@visx/responsive` could help you make this responsive to screen size
- `@visx/xychart` – this is the only "high-level" chart library in `visx`, it has a `GlpyhSeries` which allows you to render whatever shape (e.g., a circle) you want.

issue.body:
Hi, we encountered this warning 

```
Warning: findDOMNode is deprecated in StrictMode. findDOMNode was passed an instance of withBoundingRects() which is inside StrictMode. Instead, add a ref directly to the element you want to reference. Learn more about using refs safely here: https://fb.me/react-strict-mode-find-node
    in div (created by Tooltip)
    in Tooltip (created by TooltipWithBounds)
    in TooltipWithBounds (created by withBoundingRects())
```
Is it possible to replace findDOMNode with a ref in `WrappedComponent.componentDidMount` [here](https://github.com/hshoff/vx/blob/3d42c2f9ae9c79bac0b9ed0c427f492d0cc48251/packages/vx-bounds/src/enhancers/withBoundingRects.tsx)?

comment.body: I think there's something about explicitly exporting type names. while we export types elsewhere ([example](https://github.com/airbnb/visx/blob/master/packages/visx-scale/src/index.ts#L26)) it’s not a mix of component + types. my only thought at this point is that we generate both `esm` and `cjs` builds I think types (`.d.ts` files) are only exported for the `cjs` build, so if you export anything by name / that’s not `*` you might get a not defined error.

pull_request.title: internal(github-actions): add github release script
pull_request.body:
#### :house: Internal

Currently we don't create a formal [Github release](https://github.com/airbnb/visx/releases) when we release new package versions, but ideally they are up-to-date with the changelog.

This adds a script to create a release anytime we update the changelog. Logic is based on the [Github release API docs](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/releases/releases#create-a-release). These are hard to test, so the next PR can be a test-case :)

@hshoff @kristw

pull_request.title: fix(tooltip, bounds): replace findDOMNode with refs for TooltipWithBounds
pull_request.body:
#### :bug: Bug Fix
This pull request extends the withBoundingRects to use optional refs instead of findDomNode. This should solve the deprecation warning in R18 with strictMode as discussed [here](https://github.com/airbnb/visx/issues/737)
To check the fix please enable `reactStrictMode: true` in `next.config.js` in the demo package. 

This _should_ not introduce any breaking changes. If the res is not passed, withBoundingRects falls back to findDOMNode. I would appreaciate pointers on how to correctly type the `nodeRef` in `TooltipWithBounds.tsx`

pull_request.title: feat(tooltip): Enable custom portal container for tooltip
pull_request.body:
#### :rocket: Enhancements

- Enables setting a custom container for the tooltip portal when using `useTooltipInPortal`, via the `portalContainer` property.

Currently, when using `useTooltipInPortal`, the tooltip renders at the root of the document. My team is running into an issue where we are sometimes rendering a dropdown in a static tooltip, but the dropdown menu appears behind the tooltip. Setting hacky z indexes would not robustly fix the issue if there is another overlay layer that is supposed to be under the tooltip, and we figured that if we could tell the tooltip portal where to render, we could fix the bug in a clean way.

I've updated the tooltip example to show that use case:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206148-c73b224d-9937-4c33-af4d-9779ca4a8fa3.mov

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206164-970cc2c9-01dd-4d72-984a-1b34b3b6cddc.mov

comment.body:
hmm, I don't think this will necessarily update the way we want, it's just computed once and if the container changes sizes or moves this will be stale/wrong.

this is the advantage of `useMeasure`, I'm a bit apprehensive of adding this if it's potentially going to result in issues of it being stale / incorrectly positioned.

commits.message: feat(axis): add an ability to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis (#1574)

pull_request.title: feat(axis): add an ability to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis
pull_request.body:
Hi, everyone! First of all, I want to say, that I'm impressed by the `visx` project, and I'm happy that I discovered it for myself! 

Currently, we are migrating our system from `recharts` to `visx` and found out that there is no way to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis. Such ability is present in `recharts` (https://recharts.org/en-US/api/XAxis#padding, https://recharts.org/en-US/api/YAxis#padding), and now we need to work around it using `hideAxisLine` option and our custom line. So it will be nice to have it also in `visx`.  

#### :rocket: Enhancements

- add an ability to specify different paddings for the start and the end of the axis

review.body:
Hi @andreykrupskii 👋  thanks for the contribution and apologies for the delayed review – have been super busy recently so I appreciate the reminder ping 🙏 

This looks great to me! I just poked CI to run and can land it after that passes. Thanks for adding tests as well! 🔥

issue.title: security(visx/scale): Update for d3-color dependencies?
issue.body: Given this vulnerability https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-36jr-mh4h-2g58, it would be great to get an update of all visx packages that directly and indirectly use `d3-color`.

comment.body:
thanks for opening this. we don't have any direct dependencies on `d3-color`, but `yarn why d3-color` gives

```
=> Found "@visx/scale#d3-color@2.0.0"
info Reasons this module exists
   - "_project_#@visx#scale#d3-scale#d3-interpolate" depends on it
```

This affects `d3-color` versions `<3.1.0`. The `yarn.lock` file in our repo shouldn't affect consumers necessarily, they should be able to force resolve that to whatever they want. Seems like the best we could do is bump `d3-scale` in `@visx/scale`. But `d3-scale` still specifies [`"d3-interpolate": "1.2.0 - 3"`](https://github.com/d3/d3-scale/blob/83555bd759c7314420bd4240642beda5e258db9e/package.json) and `d3-interpolate` still specifies [`"d3-color": "1 - 3"`](https://github.com/d3/d3-interpolate/blob/6562b85040f7a9b96efe49b54a77eb6fceafa1c1/package.json) so even that wouldn't guarantee a fix until those packages are updated.

Is it necessary to support the `portalContainerProp` override or can it be passed in as an option? if this simplifies things we could leave it for now.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206148-c73b224d-9937-4c33-af4d-9779ca4a8fa3.mov

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6173255/190206164-970cc2c9-01dd-4d72-984a-1b34b3b6cddc.mov

issue.title: Visx leaves unwanted padding on svg element
issue.body: Hi there, I know this isn't a bug but looking for a way to left align or make 100% width this chart and couldn't find anything on the docs. Are there any options available to do this? Right now there is about 50px of padding in the .

comment.body:
Hi @ryanbrwr 👋  thanks for checking out `visx`. This isn't an issue it's a usage question so I'm converting it to a discussion.

I assume you are using the `@visx/xychart` package, which sets a default [`margin: { top: number; right: number; bottom: number; left: number; }`](https://airbnb.io/visx/docs/xychart#XYChart_margin) on the chart. You can update that to include a `margin.left=0` if you want. it's the default to accommodate `top/right/bottom/left` axes.

issue.title: Animating translation in a visx/geo projection
issue.body:
Hello!

I was looking for a bit of help, hope this is the right place to ask.

I made an interactive map with visx/zoom and visx/geo, it works amazing and as expected, panning zooming etc.

What would be the best way to smoothly animate translation?

Say, that by double clicking a geo feature, I set a new transformMatrix with a new translation position, and it smoothly interpolates to said position.

Is this possible with visx/react-spring? Time is not on my side and I was hoping some guidance would help me bury my head in the right place haha.

Also, I was hoping to achieve a similar goal with scale, say, setting a new scale and it smoothly interpolates into the new scale setting.

comment.body:
hey @coding-tomato 👋  thanks for checking out visx, since this is a usage question I'm going to move this to a discussion.

I don't have a ton of time to dig in currently (maybe someone else can!), my thinking is that `react-spring` itself might be a good avenue for animating this. in can interpolate some data structures, but not all.

issue.title: fix(grid): refactor imports to not cause de-optimization for esm bundlers
issue.body:
#### :rocket: Enhancements

When importing from `@visx/grid/lib/shapes/Line` it forces bundlers to use the CommonJS version instead of the ECMAScript Module version which leads to larger bundle sizes due to lacking tree-shaking capabilities (CommonJS uses `require` statements).

If the types are not exposed from the root barrel file they should reside in their own import as type imports will be omitted.

issue.title: @visx/area graph has stroke on the borders of the graph

comment.body:
Hi @chanzer0 👋  thanks for checking out `visx`. this is a usage question so moving it to discussion not an issue. 

this outline is a consequence of how `path` borders work. you can remove it entirely by setting `strokeWidth={0}/stroke="transparent"`. alternatively if you only want to render a border on one side of the area, you need to also render a `LinePath` from `@visx/shape` – see this for an example https://airbnb.io/visx/glyphs
